text: This is used in the video 12 years of freedom
author: Deputy Kirsanov

text: I remember this song. It was in the first Silent Hill movie, minus the speech. I also heard it in the third Silent Hill game, plus the speech. This song is on the official Silent Hill 3 soundtrack, which came with the game, both of which I own.
author: Jose M. Figueroa Jr.

text: Ahh... while i don't mind the monologue at the end on its own right, it messes me up when I'm just listening to this song on a playlist while I'm trying to write.
author: Joshua Fagan

text: "The world is teeming with unnecessary people" sounds like something Jigsaw would say.
author: Jackben Imbel

text:
Silent hill music is the perfect example of:

(while playing the game) oh man, this sets the mood/feel so perfectly
(casual listening) WTF is this bullshit, It sounds like terrible and depressing jazz or something
author: fate255

text: Its just so beautiful and mysterious at the same time.
author: Azure Alufei

text: Good atmospheric game with good music. It's a direct sequel to the first one but 17 years later and Harry's daughter is the main character. The first level is pretty big and i was feeling very powerless because of the darkness and the big ass enemies you had to avoid.
author: bastardrian

text: So creepy but beautiful, this is what i loved about the silent hill soundtracks, they would be weirdly... calming? Really calling for another play through!
author: ZOZO

text: サイレントヒルの音楽いいよねー＾＾

text: aaaaaahhhhhhhhh so Dark and Sinister..........  so scary oooohhhhhhh.........

text: I love the music by Yamaoka for this series.  It is very hauntingly beautiful to listen to.  I have only listened to one soundtrack in this series.  That might have to change sometime soon.
author: Eric C.

text:

It seems the Easter Bunny this year will have to be Pyramid Head.

text: Replaying it right now! Miraculously, it still holds up today, graphically AND gameplay-wise :) And the soundtrack will never get old.
